list_definition.definition: (a singer having) a male voice of the lowest pitch

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He sings in a rich bass.

list_definition.definition: a type of fish of the perch family

list_ex_of_english: Sustained and transient potassium currents of cultured horizontal cells isolated from white bass retina.
The basso continuo is, in essence, a seguente bass throughout.
What we are left with is a massive chordal setting of the vocal chorus accompanied by just the organ and bass.
Percussion, bass, keyboards and guitar all follow the same pattern of chord changes in exactly the same rhythm and with the same accents.
Its instrumentation is flexible, but will typically include a rhythm section (percussion, bass, piano) and frontline musicians (saxophone/ trumpet/ voice etc).
The air is brief and simple, with only continuo bass accompaniment.
The concerto begins with a brief fusillade of demisemiquavers from the violins, underpinned by the bass drum and capped by flourishes from the soloists.
The synthesised bass is extremely restless, moving mostly by tritone and half-step, and traversing the chromatic aggregate save for one pitch.
